title: Data Engineer
description:
### **About 0TO9**


Ideas are everywhere, but people make them real. Founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt, **0to9** is a fintech venture builder, the bank for entrepreneurship.


We provide the capital, tech, and talent so founders can stop fighting red tape and start building. Our name reflects the building blocks of finance: with the numbers 0 through 9, you can create anything. We are building the infrastructure for the future, and we are just getting started.

### **The Journey**


As our Data Engineer, you won’t just move data, you will build the brain of our organization. You will design and own the scalable ELT pipelines that turn raw numbers into strategic impact.  

  

**You will:**

* **Build & Scale:** Design ELT pipelines into Snowflake using dbt and AWS (S3, Lambda).
* **Architect:** Define and evolve data models (star/snowflake schemas) that power our analytics and product decisions.
* **Ensure Trust:** Implement robust observability and alerting to ensure our data is always reliable and high-quality.
* **Collaborate:** Partner with business stakeholders to translate complex requirements into clean, high-performance data products.
* **Innovate:** Drive engineering best practices through CI/CD, automation, and reusable code.

### **Are you the one?**


You are a builder at heart who understands that great data is the foundation of every great fintech. You enjoy the technical challenge of a modern cloud stack but also have the business grasp to know *why* the numbers matter.


Your Toolkit:

* Tech Stack: Strong SQL and Python skills, with hands-on experience in Snowflake and dbt.
* Cloud: Solid AWS experience (specifically S3 and Lambda).
* Engineering: A proven track record of building reliable pipelines and working with Git-based CI/CD workflows.
* Mindset: You can challenge requirements, clarify use cases, and deliver data products that actually drive decisions.


Extra Credits / Nice to have:

* Experience with Fivetran, Omni, or Looker.
* Knowledge of orchestration tools (Airflow/Dagster) or data observability.
* A background in FinTech or high-growth finance environments.

### **What’s in it for you?**

* Work from "Sweden’s Most Beautiful Office 2025" in the heart of Stockholm.
* A fast-paced, international, and entrepreneurial environment where your work has a direct impact.
* Massive opportunities to develop alongside a team that truly loves what they do.
* Be part of the leading venture builder redefining the future of finance.

**Ready to build from 0 to 9? Apply now.**

title: Cloud Solution Architect-Power Platform
description:
**Overview**  

With more than 45,000 employees and partners worldwide, the Customer Experience and Success (CE&S) organization is on a mission to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. We drive cross-company alignment and execution, ensuring that we consistently exceed customers’ expectations in every interaction, whether in-product, digital, or human-centered. CE&S is responsible for all up services across the company, including consulting, customer success, and support across Microsoft’s portfolio of solutions and products. Join CE&S and help us accelerate AI transformation for our customers and the world.


We are seeking a **Cloud Solution Architect (CSA)** who is passionate about guiding and enabling customers in **low‑code application development and AI agent innovation**. In this customer-facing role, you will be a strategic advisor and trusted technical expert, driving value realization across **Power Platform** and **Copilot Studio**.


Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

 **Responsibilities**  

* Be a trusted advisor and drive business value through AI Transformation: Create business value by translating customer challenges into actionable solutions aligned to high ROI customer outcomes. Ensure a seamless, connected experience that fosters satisfaction, loyalty, and long-term value.
* Drive Customer Success: Lead architectural design, engaging with business and technical decision makers to drive intent and enable sustained usage of Power Platform & Copilot Studio securing long-term customer success and renewal.
* Explore growth opportunities: Partner with technical and sales teams to identify opportunities and develop tailored solutions to drive expansion and business value realization.
* Accelerate AI Agent Journey: Engage in relevant communities to share expertise, contribute to IP creation, prioritize IP re-use, and learn from others to help accelerate your customer’s AI transformation journey.
* Drive Consumption/Usage through Unified Support Plans: Delivers solutions using company methodologies and proven practices/patterns to support customer readiness and goals. Proactively applies change management to drive adoption, customer satisfaction and consumption/usage. Designs well architected solutions to boost retention & growth.
* Deliver Customer Satisfaction: Drives self and guides other team members to focus on customer/partner experience through efficient delivery and ensuring a seamless and connected customer experience.
* Embrace a growth mindset: Act as the voice of the customer by proactively sharing insights, feedback, and success stories to inform internal strategy and execution.
* Learn-it-all: Demonstrate a self-learner mindset through continuous, self-directed learning in areas such as AI agent development, business value realization, and adoption and change management. Build and maintain technical readiness aligned to Customer Success Unit (CSU) priorities and corporate initiatives.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, Liberal Arts or related field
	+ AND some experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting OR equivalent experience
	+ OR equivalent experience
* Some experience with relevant technologies (Power Platform or Copilot Studio)

  

  

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

  

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process**.**
company_description: Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

title: Manager to our Banking & Financial Services Engineering Team
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Are you an experienced Agile Transformation Change Leader or Agile Delivery specialist with a passion for banking? Deloitte AB in Stockholm is looking for talented professionals with 4-6 years of experience to join our team and help drive agile change within the financial services sector.
   

  

  





 In this role, you will be key to accelerating agile transformations and delivering agile projects that empower our banking clients to enhance efficiency, innovation, and business outcomes. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement agile operating models tailored to complex banking environments.
   

  

  





**What You’ll Do**



* Build, test, and implement technology solutions for leading banks and financial institutions.
* Work in Agile delivery teams, supporting iterative development and continuous improvement.
* Drive transformation projects in core banking, payments, cards, lending, compliance, and risk management.
* Collaborate across Deloitte’s Swedish and global practices to deliver future-proofed solutions.
* Act as a bridge between business and technology, contributing to product roadmaps and delivery.
* Ensure that technical solutions meet business needs as well as security and regulatory requirements.
* Lead and coach defined projects and smaller teams, fostering collaboration, driving performance, and ensuring successful delivery of objectives.


**Qualifications**

**What We Are Looking For:**



* 4-6 years’ experience as a consultant within Business Agility, Agile Transformation Change Leader or Agile Delivery (Agile Project Management) professional within banking
* Strong understanding of agile frameworks and proven experience leading or supporting agile transformations and delivery teams
* Expertise in at least two of the following areas:
	+ Value stream design and agile operating model development
	+ Agile tooling such as JIRA and Confluence, including configuration or migration
	+ Lean Portfolio Management
	+ Agile people management, including agile practices for line organizations
	+ Product Management, including business analysis or product ownership focused on lifecycle and continuous improvement
	+ DevOps and/or agile testing and quality assurance
* Willingness to travel
* You are working and living in Sweden
* Proficiency in Swedish and English and strong communication skills


**Preferred Knowledge:**
* Experience working in core banking domains such as Payments, Lending, Savings, Cards, AML, Risk, Compliance, Trading & Capital Markets or Finance and Regulatory Reporting
* Meriting if you previously held roles within Banking such as Product Owner, Scrum Master, RTE, Coach, Epic Owner or Transformation Lead
* Ability to apply agile principles within regulated and complex banking environments
* Familiar with concepts such as systems/design thinking, dual operating system and Scaled Agile frameworks such as SAFe, Scrum at Scale or Spotify.
* Academic background in behavioral science, engineering or information systems


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to work with Sweden’s largest financial services clients in Agile delivery set-ups.
* A collaborative and inclusive workplace at our Stockholm office, with hybrid flexibility.
* Continuous learning and professional development, including certifications in Agile, cloud, and financial services.
* Competitive compensation and benefits tailored to the Swedish market.
* Clear career growth opportunities within Deloitte’s Financial Services and Engineering practices.


  

  

  


**Ready to Make an Impact?**




 If you’re passionate about engineering, Agile delivery, and product ownership within banking, Deloitte Sweden offers the platform to accelerate your career and shape the future of financial services.
   

  

  




**Additional Information**

**How to Apply:**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* Letter of motivation
	+ Why you are interested in Deloitte and the role as a consultant
	+ What you think you can contribute with and bring to the role


**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we work with ongoing selection.**
  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**

 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Anna Taube, Manager Talent Acquisition, at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Business System Analyst
description:
**Job Description: Business System Analyst** 
**Role Summary** 

 The
 **Business System Analyst (BSA)** 
 serves as the key liaison between business stakeholders and IT delivery teams, ensuring that business needs are accurately captured, analyzed, documented, and translated into scalable, high-quality solutions. Operating within an enterprise Agile environment, the BSA uses
 **Jira** 
 and
 **Confluence** 
 as systems of record for requirements, traceability, documentation, and delivery governance. The role supports all phases of the
 **System Life Cycle (SLC)** 
 to ensure compliance, audit readiness, and successful end-to-end delivery.
 


**Key Outcomes / Success Measures** 
* Well-maintained, prioritized backlog with items consistently meeting
 **Definition of Ready (DoR)** 
 .
* Requirements that are
 **testable, traceable, and aligned** 
 with SLC stage gates.
* **End-to-end traceability** 
 from business objectives through release.
* Reduced defects and rework through clear acceptance criteria and alignment.
* Audit-ready documentation in Confluence linked to Jira items.
* Actionable Jira dashboards supporting visibility, planning, and decision-making.


**Main Responsibilities** 
**1. Enterprise Requirements Management (Agile)** 
* Lead requirements gathering through interviews, workshops, backlog grooming, and process analysis.
* Translate business needs into
 **Initiatives, Epics, Features (where applicable), and User Stories** 
 with clear acceptance criteria.
* Ensure backlog items meet
 **Definition of Ready (DoR)** 
 and support
 **Definition of Done (DoD)** 
 .
* Manage scope changes through structured impact analysis and updates in Jira/Confluence.
* Collaborate with Product Owners to prioritize based on value, dependencies, and team capacity.


**2. Jira – Backlog & Delivery Management** 
* Use
 **Jira** 
 as the authoritative system for requirements, tracking, and delivery.
* Create and maintain Initiatives, Epics, Stories, Tasks, and Bugs with proper hierarchy and linking.
* Support workflows, custom fields, issue types, automation rules, and
 **Advanced Roadmaps** 
 .
* Develop and interpret dashboards and reports for visibility into delivery flow, risks, and dependencies.


**3. Confluence – Documentation & Knowledge Management** 
* Create and maintain high-quality documentation: requirements, functional specs, process flows, decision logs, and runbooks.
* Use enterprise templates to ensure structure, consistency, and audit compliance.
* Maintain document version control, approvals, and traceability to Jira artifacts.


**4. System Life Cycle (SLC) Support & Governance** 
* Support all SLC phases from initiation through post-implementation.
* Contribute to SLC deliverables including
 **BRD/FRS** 
 ,
 **RTM** 
 , impact assessments, test scenarios, UAT readiness, release documentation, and post-release validation.
* Ensure stage-gate compliance and maintain auditable evidence in Jira and Confluence.
* Participate in solution design and architecture reviews to validate functional and non-functional requirements.


**5. Collaboration, Quality & Continuous Improvement** 
* Work closely with Product Owners, Architects, Developers, QA, Operations, and Delivery Managers.
* Participate in Agile ceremonies including standups, sprint planning, grooming, reviews, and retrospectives.
* Support defect triage, test case alignment, and UAT preparation.
* Track and maintain KPIs/metrics to improve analysis practices, documentation, and tooling.


**Qualifications** 
**Education & Certifications** 
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Preferred:
 **CSM/PSPO** 
 ,
 **SAFe** 
 ,
 **IIBA certifications** 
 , ITIL, Jira/Confluence certifications.


**Experience & Skills** 
* **3–7+ years** 
 of experience as a Business Analyst or System Analyst in enterprise environments.
* Strong hands-on experience with
 **Jira and Confluence** 
 .
* Exposure to Agile delivery methodologies (Scrum/Kanban; SAFe preferred).
* Strong analytical thinking, facilitation, communication, and documentation skills.
* Ability to translate complex business needs into structured, testable requirements.


**Tools & Platforms** 
* **Jira (Software)** 
 ,
 **Confluence**
* Advanced Roadmaps, Miro, Visio, Lucidchart, or similar diagramming tools
* ALM tools; nice to have: CI/CD pipelines, ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow), BI tools

title: IT Project Manager / Scrum Master
description:
**Job Description: IT Project Manager / Scrum Master** 
**Role Summary** 

 The
 **IT Project Manager / Scrum Master** 
 is responsible for planning, coordinating, and delivering IT initiatives while serving as a Scrum Master for Agile teams. This role blends traditional project management with Agile execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives, System Life Cycle (SLC) governance, and enterprise delivery standards. The position requires strong leadership, cross-functional coordination, and the ability to drive predictable, high-quality outcomes across multiple teams.
 


**Key Outcomes / Success Measures** 
* IT projects delivered
 **on time, within scope and budget** 
 , and meeting defined business objectives.
* Agile teams operate with
 **clear cadence** 
 , well-run ceremonies, and continuous improvement.
* Proactive and transparent management of
 **risks, dependencies, and impediments** 
 .
* Full compliance with
 **SLC/SDLC stage gates** 
 , governance, and audit requirements.
* Stakeholders receive
 **accurate and timely visibility** 
 into plans, progress, risks, and delivery outcomes.


**Main Responsibilities** 
**1. Project Management & Delivery Ownership** 
* Manage IT projects end-to-end from initiation through delivery and closure.
* Create and maintain detailed
 **project plans, schedules, milestones** 
 , and dependencies using PM tools (e.g., MS Project, Planner).
* Track progress, manage budgets (where required), and oversee risks, issues, and dependencies.
* Coordinate delivery across
 **cross-functional teams, vendors, and partner groups** 
 .
* Ensure delivery aligns with approved business goals and priorities.


**2. Scrum Master Responsibilities (Agile Execution)** 
* Serve as Scrum Master for one or more Agile teams, driving
 **Agile mindset and practices** 
 .
* Facilitate key Agile ceremonies:
 **Sprint Planning, Daily Stand-ups, Reviews, and Retrospectives** 
 .
* Support team predictability through coaching, metrics, and continuous improvement.
* Identify and drive resolution of
 **delivery impediments** 
 .
* Foster transparency, collaboration, and shared accountability.


**3. Planning, Reporting & Governance** 
* Maintain
 **integrated delivery plans** 
 across Agile and non-Agile workstreams.
* Provide routine
 **status updates** 
 on progress, risks, issues, and forecasts.
* Use project and delivery metrics to support decision-making.
* Support release, PI, and roadmap planning, including capacity and dependency management.


**4. System Life Cycle (SLC) Support & Compliance** 
* Ensure all project activities meet
 **SLC/SDLC governance** 
 and stage-gate requirements.
* Coordinate required SLC deliverables, approvals, and release readiness tasks.
* Maintain proper documentation and evidence for audits and governance reviews.


**5. Stakeholder & Change Management** 
* Act as the primary delivery contact for technical and business stakeholders.
* Communicate clearly to manage expectations and ensure transparency.
* Support change management processes and escalate issues/decisions when needed.


**6. Continuous Improvement**

title: Media Data Analyst
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
  

 As a Media Data Analyst, you will be part of the team responsible for building strong analytical foundations that enable consistent and scalable marketing measurement across markets. This role focuses on analytical execution, data quality, and transforming media data into reliable insights that support decision-making.
   

  





 You will work closely with the Media Analyst, as well as Attribution and Data & BI teams, while reporting to Global Measurement & Analytics Manager.
   

  





 Your responsibilities include:
   

  




* You will support in reporting, creating dashboards, taxonomy implementation, and ongoing performance analysis.


* Delivering recurring media performance analysis and reporting across paid media channels


* Preparing, validating, and structuring data for media analytics and attribution use cases


* Ensure taxonomy design supports scalable measurement, attribution, and business decision-making


* Supporting the execution of dashboard development in collaboration with Data & BI specialists


* Supporting analytical deep dives related to campaigns, always-on performance, and key initiatives


* Ensuring documentation, structure, and consistency across analytics deliverables



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**
  

 You will collaborate closely with Media Analyst, the Attribution team, Data & BI specialists, and marketing activation teams to support high-quality marketing analytics across the organization.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**
  

 We are looking for someone early in their analytics career who is eager to grow, learn, and develop. You’ll be given the appropriate support to evolve while contributing independently.
   

  

  

  

 You likely have:
   

  




* 1–3 years of experience in analytics, marketing analytics, or media performance analysis


* Experience working with data and analytical tools (Excel, Power BI, SQL or similar)


* A genuine interest in digital media, marketing performance, and measurement frameworks



 And someone who is:
   

  




* Structured, detail-oriented, and comfortable working with data


* Curious and eager to learn


* Collaborative and proactive in a team environment



**WHO WE ARE**
  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  




* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP.



**JOIN US**
  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 Apply now and upload your CV via the link.

title: Business Analyst - Reverse Supply
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
  

 We are looking for a curious and self-driven Business Analyst to join our Supply Planning Unit. In this role, you will lead analytics initiatives and maintain and develop systems for all three Reverse Supply areas (External Exit and overstock selling, faulty items and garment collection). You’ll play a key part in the team in helping unwanted garments get a new life, and ensure the garments end up in the right place! As a proactive self-starter, you will take ownership of projects from hypothesis to insight and delivery, thrive on ambiguity, ask the right questions, and challenge the status quo.  This position requires a blend of business acumen and analytical skills.
   

  





 Your key responsibilities include:
   

  




* Lead analytics initiatives from hypothesis to delivery, turning data into actionable insights.


* Own and develop internal applications supporting overstock sales and partner management.


* Use SQL and Power BI to gather, clean, and visualize data.


* Develop and maintain web-based applications.


* Maintain and follow-up on sustainability KPIs for business development and public disclosure.


* Act as the go-to person for data and application-related questions and incidents


* Drive automation and data validation in areas with manual processes.


* Collaborate cross-functionally within Supply Planning and across H&M Group.



**WHO YOU ARE**
  

 Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a business-minded, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability, business acumen, self-drive with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.
   

  





*We are looking for people with ...*



* Years of experience in a data-driven role within supply chain operations, ideally in overstock handling, returns management, or circular fashion initiatives.


* Proven hands-on experience with SQL for querying large datasets, and Power BI for building dashboards and visualizing KPIs.


* Experience with Python or other programming language for automation, C# for application logic, and JavaScript for web-application development is a bonus.


* Experience with Power Automate for workflow optimization is a strong plus.


* Exposure to Cloud Platforms and maintaining web-based applications, especially in the context of internal business applications and data pipelines, is beneficial.



*And people who are...*



* Strong communicators and storytellers with the skills and ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various different stakeholders.


* Curious and take the initiative, driven to explore new ideas, ask questions, and take ownership from start to finish


* Based in Stockholm and able to commute to the office 4 days/week (no relocation support).



**Please Note!** 
 This is a temporary position that will run from as soon as possible until January 2027.
   

  





  

  





**WHO WE ARE** 
**​**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





 ​
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
**​**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. ​
   

  




* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* ​30 days holiday
* Collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 4000kr/year
* Beniflex Benefits Portal
* Community with activities



  

  





**JOIN US** 
**​**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





*\** 
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.* 
 ​

title: 2nd line Support
description:
Vi söker nu en serviceinriktad och tekniskt kunnig
 **IT‑tekniker** 
 som kommer att arbeta som
 **Second Line Support** 
 i en engagerad och kompetent miljö. Rollen passar dig som brinner för att hjälpa användare, har god teknisk förståelse och trivs i en roll där du dagligen löser varierande och mer komplexa IT‑relaterade ärenden.
 



 Som Second Line‑tekniker arbetar du nära användare, främst via Teams och telefon och hanterar ärenden som skickas vidare från Servicedesk i vårt ärendehanteringssystem baserat på ServiceNow. Du arbetar både självständigt och tillsammans med ett team av supporttekniker på plats i Solna, där du spelar en nyckelroll i att leverera högkvalitativ support och stabila IT‑lösningar.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Felsöka och lösa mer komplexa IT‑ärenden via Servicedesk (ServiceNow).
* Stödja användare via Teams, telefon och på plats.
* Arbeta strukturerat med dokumentation och uppföljning av ärenden.
* Samarbeta med ett erfaret supportteam och bidra till kontinuerliga förbättringar.
* Hantera incidenter, förändringsärenden och problemhantering enligt etablerade processer.



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har ett genuint intresse för teknik och ett starkt servicefokus.
* Trivs i en dynamisk miljö där förutsättningarna snabbt kan skifta.
* Är proaktiv, affärsmässig och har lätt för att kommunicera.
* Är social, lyhörd och bygger lätt upp ett brett kontaktnät i organisationen.
* Är självgående men även en lagspelare som gärna delar med sig av kunskap.
* Tar initiativ och bidrar aktivt med förbättringsförslag och processutveckling.



  





**Kravprofil** 



* Minst
 **2 års erfarenhet** 
 av slutanvändarsupport.
* Erfarenhet av
 **systematisk felsökning** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av arbete i
 **ärendehanteringssystem** 
 (gärna ServiceNow).

 **Microsoftmiljöer** 
 .

 .

 **infrastruktur** 
 , servrar, nätverk, SCCM, databaser m.m.
* **ITIL‑kunskap** 
 .
* God förmåga att dokumentera.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av arbete i en större koncern eller komplex IT‑miljö.
* Erfarenhet som nivå 2 eller nivå 3‑tekniker.



  





**Övrigt** 



* Uppdragets period:
 **2026‑03‑01 till 2026‑12‑31** 
 .

 **100%** 
 .

 .

 **på plats**

 **remote upp till två dagar per vecka** 
 .

**Kontakt** 




 För frågor om uppdraget, kontakta ansvarig Business Manager,
 **Joanna Nyström @** 
 joanna.nystrom@akkodisgroup.com
 



  





**Om Akkodis** 




 På Akkodis är du som konsult vår högsta prioritet. Vi stöttar dig i din karriärutveckling och erbjuder uppdrag i olika branscher, system och miljöer. Du omfattas av kollektivavtal, försäkringar, friskvårdsbidrag och rabatter på träningskort. Vi ordnar regelbundet sociala aktiviteter och arbetar tillsammans för att skapa framtidens lösningar inom IT och Engineering.
 



  





 Varm välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Analyst, Strategic Planning
description:
**Who We Are**




 Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviors.
   

  





 We are feeding the world’s curiosity!
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**The Opportunity**




 Cint is looking to strengthen its strategy team with an experienced analyst to take on critical projects.
   

  





 This is an opportunity to apply your skill set to contribute to shaping and implementing the strategy of the company, be exposed and work with senior leaders, and get a deep understanding of how a technology company operates.
   

  





 The Team
   

  





 Our strategy and transformation team partners with Cinters and leaders across the company to articulate our near to long term strategy, create alignment around it and drive transformation and change. We champion data-driven decision making, thorough market and internal analysis, and bring problem solving approaches to tackle Cint’s key challenges.
   

  





 You will report to the Director of Strategic Planning and partner with several teams across the organization to deliver high-impact projects.
   

  





**What You Will Do**



* Work closely with senior management, stakeholders, and senior members of the team to support the strategic planning process as well as our strategic projects
* Conduct research and analysis on various aspects of our business, such as our market, competition, customers, products, and processes
* Build complex models to evaluate impact of various scenarios and support decision making
* Drive creation of high impact decision making materials
* Continuously gather insights on our ecosystem to build unparalleled understanding of our market
* Be a trusted advisor to the team and senior stakeholders related to any market or business intelligence


**Qualifications**

**What We Are Looking For**



* 3 years of experience working in top tier strategy consulting or internal strategy team of a technology company
* Excellent analytical skills and ability to work with complex data and information
* Strong business acumen and able to identify trends, opportunities, evaluate risks and challenges
* Ability to develop and present strategic recommendations based on findings
* Strong communication skills to work, be credible and become a trusted partner to senior leadership
* Proficient with Excel and PowerPoint, knowledge of data analytics tools is a plus (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau)
* Tech-savvy and interested in the consumer insights space
* Flexible and adaptable, with a proven ability to navigate ambiguity and change
* Even though this is a remote role. We would expect you to visit our office as and when required based on the team's need (2-3 visits a month)



  

  





**Bonus Points If You Have**



* Previous experience working in global, multi-cultural environments
* Having conducted or bought market research surveys is a plus but not required


**Additional Information**

  

  





**Our Values**




**Collaboration is our superpower**



* We uncover rich perspectives across the world
* Success happens together
* We deliver across borders.



**Innovation is in our blood**



* We’re pioneers in our industry
* Our curiosity is insatiable
* We bring the best ideas to life.



**We do what we say**



* We’re accountable for our work and actions
* Excellence comes as standard
* We’re open, honest and kind, always.



**We are caring**



* We learn from each other’s experiences
* Stop and listen; every opinion matters
* We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.



  

  





**More About Cint**




 We’re proud to be recognised in Newsweek’s 2025 Global Top 100 Most Loved Workplaces®, reflecting our commitment to a culture of trust, respect, and employee growth.
   

  





 In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.
   

  





 Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)
   

  





  

  





 Additionally, in a world of AI, we want our candidates to understand our approach to the use of AI during the interview and hiring process, so we'd appreciate you reading our AI usage guide.

title: Store Designer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 We are looking for Store Designers to join our Retail experience function at H&M on a temporary contract. As part of our team, you help us realize store projects all over the world, through collaboration with many brilliant colleagues, reflected in high-quality design solutions and commercial plans based on customer needs and behaviours. You will:
   

  




* Effectively collaborate to project-specific research about customer and project objectives, including some analytical tasks connected to the brand’s commercial plans
* Create and/or review architectural and interior design packages as well as construction documents for various types of projects
* Ensure strong communication with multiple project teams, contractors, consultants, and local H&M Group teams
* Provide on brand solutions to resolve technical and design challenges
* Ensure the timely issuing of all the deliveries connected with the projects.
* Follow up on your projects and take ownership of analysing both successes and learnings.


**Qualifications**

* A bachelor’s degree and background in Architecture or Interior Design
* Solid understanding of spatial development - from early concept work to full‑scale detailing
* Experience in retail architecture or a strong passion for fashion, retail, and the opportunities within the industry
* Approximately 1 -6 years of experience in commercial/retail architecture or interior design, with a focus on layout design and planning; international experience or education is a plus
* Strong understanding of the full lifecycle of real estate projects -from exploration and negotiation to business cases, approvals, design, procurement, construction, and follow‑up
* Proficiency in Revit (mandatory); knowledge of AutoCAD is a plus



 Strong project‑management and presentation skills, with the ability to drive and balance multiple projects simultaneously

title: Operativ IT-support producerande verksamhet
description:
**W5 Solutions är en ledande leverantör av avancerade system och lösningar för försvar, säkerhet och samhällsskydd. Vi stödjer svenska och internationella myndigheter samt industriella aktörer med teknologier och tjänster som stärker operativ förmåga inom våra tre affärsområden
 *Training* 
 ,
 *Power* 
 , och
 *Integration* 
 .**
**Genom ett starkt fokus på innovation, kvalitet och hållbarhet levererar vi skräddarsydda lösningar som möter högt ställda krav i kritiska miljöer. Vår verksamhet bygger på lång erfarenhet, teknisk expertis och ett starkt engagemang för våra kunders långsiktiga framgång.**
**Om rollen**
 Affärsområde Integration i Solna söker dig som vill arbeta med IT-support och trivs med att stötta användare som jobbar i produktionsmiljö. Tjänsten erbjuder ett varierat uppdrag i en miljö där IT, affärssystem och produktion möts. Det är en operativ och självständig roll där du blir ett viktigt stöd för organisationens dagliga arbete, särskilt i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet.
   

  

 Rollen passar dig som har förståelse för hur affärssystem används i producerande företag och som trivs med att arbeta praktiskt, nära användarna. Du blir en närvarande funktion på kontoret som bidrar både med tekniskt stöd och med att rutiner och arbetssätt formas och utvecklas över tid.
   

  

* Stötta användare i affärssystemet Monitor G5, inklusive administration av behörigheter, hantering av åtkomster och enklare inköp.
* Hjälpa kollegor i IT-relaterade frågor kopplat till Teams, Outlook, SharePoint och andra verktyg.
* Bistå vid utbyte och uppdatering av datorer och telefoner samt vara behjälplig vid installation av appar, e-post och tekniska inställningar.
* Fungera som kontaktperson mellan kontoret i Solna, den centrala IT-funktionen och företagets IT-leverantör.
* Ansvara för mötesrumsteknik, informationsskärmar och enklare felsökning av teknisk utrustning.
* Utföra praktiska uppgifter relaterade till larm, passersystem och fastighetsnära ärenden.


**Vem vi söker**
 Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av teknisk support i en produktionsnära roll i ett tillverkande företag. Du har god vana att arbeta i Windowsmiljö och med Office 365, inklusive felsökning, stöttning vid uppstart och utbyte av datorer och mobila enheter. Du har goda kunskaper i Monitor G5 och förstår systemets uppbyggnad, ett krav för att kunna stötta andra effektivt. Du har minst gymnasial utbildning inom IT eller teknik eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet och uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
   

  

 Som person är du serviceinriktad, pedagogisk och lyhörd. Du tar ansvar, är lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du arbetar självständigt men är en naturlig del av teamet. Du har lätt för att ta initiativ, kommunicerar tydligt och inger förtroende i kontakt med användare på olika nivåer. För att trivas i rollen behöver du gilla att vara på plats, trivas med sociala kontakter och vilja bidra aktivt.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du arbetar hos oss på W5 Solutions får du mer än bara ett jobb – du blir en del av ett sammanhang där din kompetens uppskattas och din utveckling prioriteras. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med varierande och meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, moderna tekniska lösningar och tydlig koppling till samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt, arbeta nära engagerade och kunniga kollegor och bidra till projekt som verkligen gör skillnad. Vi värnar om gemenskap, balans mellan arbete och fritid samt en kultur där idéer uppmuntras och varje medarbetare är en viktig del av helheten.
   

  

 W5 Solutions är en attraktiv arbetsgivare för dig som söker en professionell miljö där din kompetens tas till vara och där du får möjlighet att bidra till samhällsviktig utveckling.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering tar vi hjälp av vår partner TNG och urvalet sker löpande.

title: Consultants & Senior Consultants (1-4 Years) | Financial Services | Stockholm
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 457,000 people in more than 150 countries and territories and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission—to make an impact that matters—remains unchanged.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Job Description**




 Are you an experienced and driven professional ready to take the next step in your career? Deloitte is seeking talented individuals to join our Financial Services team in Stockholm. As a consultant, you will collaborate with decision-makers across the Banking and Insurance sectors to drive significant business outcomes.
   

  

  





 You will play a key role in collaborating with clients and Deloitte colleagues to transform client organisations, core business processes and technology. This includes driving business transformation, implementing new processes and technology, improving operational efficiency, and designing new operating models. You will work in a team setup where you will support the client in large-scale transformations, taking on roles such as Business Analyst, Project Manager, Product Owner, or Test Lead. You will take part in the full life cycle across designing, testing, deployment and implementation, ensuring alignment with business objectives and continuous improvement.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Requirements to succeed in this role:**



* 1-4 years of professional experience, ideally from a leading Management Consulting firm or a business transformation role.
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Engineering, Information Systems).
* Experience working in Financial Services, including e.g.:
	+ Banking: Payments, Lending, Savings, Cards, AML, Risk, and Compliance.
	+ Capital Markets: Trading and Finance/Regulatory Reporting.
	+ Insurance: System implementation experience related to Underwriting, Claims or for Personal/Corporate products.
* Demonstrated interest or experience in business and IT transformations, project management, test management, product management, requirements management, data migration, software development, ITIL, and agile methodologies.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive and self-motivated mindset.
* Professional fluency in both Swedish and English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Flexibility to travel for business purposes.


**You should be able to demonstrate experience from one or more of the following areas:**
* Experience working at the intersection between business and IT, including system implementation, system and cloud migration, and vendor selection.
* Experience with project, program, or product management, particularly large-scale business and IT change initiatives.
* Experience with agile frameworks (e.g., SAFe, Spotify Scrum at Scale) and leading or supporting Financial Services transformations with agile delivery set-ups in roles such as Product Owner, Scrum Master, Epic Owner or Agile Coach.


**Additional Information**

**What We Offer**



* Access to a global firm and a powerful network of experienced colleagues
* Great possibilities for you to develop yourself and our business
* Many opportunities for exchange of experiences, training and personal development
* Access to one of the world's largest consultancy organisations, global training programs and specialist networks
* A chance of becoming a key player with a fast-growing career, in the national and global consulting arena
* Competitive compensation and benefits


**How to apply**

 You apply online. As a part of your application please submit:
   

  

  




* CV
* Short motivational letter which includes your industry focus (if any)
* University grades



**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: IT Compliance Officer, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about turning complex regulations into smart, business-friendly solutions?
   

  

 Do you thrive in environments where structure meets innovation and where your work directly strengthens digital trust across an entire organization?
   

  

 At PostNord, we are on a mission to build a resilient and transparent cybersecurity landscape that supports our digital transformation. As our new IT Compliance Officer, you will be at the heart of this journey and leading our compliance efforts across NIS2, IT General Controls (ITGC), and ISO/IEC 27001:2022. This is a unique opportunity to shape how we govern, report, and continuously improve our IT security posture across the Nordics.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As IT Compliance Officer, you will play a pivotal role in PostNord’s CyberSecurity team. You will take ownership of our compliance framework across NIS2, IT General Controls (ITGC), and ISO/IEC 27001:2022, ensuring that our policies, controls, and processes are not only compliant - but effective, scalable and aligned with our business goals.
   

  

**You Will Also**
* Design and operate an integrated compliance program that enables risk-based reporting to leadership and external stakeholders.
* Ensure our controls are well-designed, implemented, and operating effectively — with clear evidence and audit readiness.
* Coordinate internal and external audits and act as a trusted point of contact for auditors and regulators.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Legal, Procurement, Finance, HR, and product/solution owners to translate standards into practical, business-friendly controls.
* Ensure ITGC governance is followed across key stakeholders, and coordinate control execution, evidence collection, and remediation tracking.
* Support OT Security in aligning NIS2 and ISO requirements with operational technology policies and roles.
* Deliver quarterly dashboards and insights to the IT Leadership Team and Group Leadership Team, supporting strategic decision-making.


**Who are we looking for?**
 To succeed in this role, you need to be based in the greater Stockholm area, as close collaboration with teams and stakeholders on-site is an important part of the role. We are looking for someone who thrives in a structured environment but knows how to navigate complexity. You bring a pragmatic approach to problem-solving, with a sharp eye for detail and a strong sense of structure. Your deep technical knowledge is matched by your ability to communicate clearly and concisely, whether you are presenting to leadership, collaborating with external auditors, or aligning with internal stakeholders. You build trust across departments, foster collaboration, and know how to turn regulatory frameworks into practical, business-friendly solutions that support both compliance and innovation.
   

  

 ,
   

  

* A university degree or equivalent experience.
* 7+ years of experience in information security, IT audit/assurance, or risk with at least 3 years leading compliance or assurance programs.
* Expertise in ISMS design and operation, ITGC domains, and control mapping.
* Bonus points for certifications such as ISO 27001 Lead Implementer/Auditor, CISA, CISM, or CRISC.


**We Offer You**
 We are a modern, customer-oriented company that cares as much about our employees as we do about our customers. With us, you are offered a varied job in an international environment with constant new challenges and quick decisions. In addition to fair employment conditions according to collective agreements, we offer you:
   

  

* Flexible hybrid workplace. Watch the film about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**About Us**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favourite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at group.postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application! The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email erkan.kahraman@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga
