title: Design Manager (Visual)
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Design Manager** 
 to lead and contribute to our Visual Design practice supporting brand and site experiences. This is a
 **hands-on leadership role** 
 suited to experienced designers who excel in people management, delivery ownership and strategic thinking.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

 Your work will entail the application and evolution of existing guidelines, ensuring consistency across touchpoints. You will lead a variety of projects ranging from marketing campaign assets, data visualization, print and UI design related projects. You will be collaborating closely with the design systems and the sites team, influencing the UI of all our digital experiences. You will have opportunities to get involved in various stretch projects that go beyond the scope of brand design, allowing you to drive cross-department collaboration.
   

  

 As Design Manager, you will lead a team of visual designers responsible for brand and site-related work across Canonical. You will drive innovation, set direction, maintain quality, and ensure delivery supporting continuous professional growth of the visual design team. You will be able to step-in and craft exceptional visual solutions to set the creative vision. You will be expected to lead by example, not by theory alone.
   

  

 On a day to day basis:
   

  

* Reviewing work critically and constructively, striving for excellence and consistency through direct feedback
* Contributing hands-on design work when capacity or complexity requires it
* Working with individual designers to support their professional growth
* Continuously overseeing and improving operational workflows, including production processes
* Working with stakeholders, especially Marketing, Web Engineering and Design Systems Director, to clearly define and validate outcomes
* Evolving design systems and guidelines to drive consistent quality and improve efficiency
* Coordinating with the rest of design leadership to mature our collective practice
* Bringing your team and others together to share their work and strengthen culture
* Helping make the value of design legible across the organisation and open source community


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* A portfolio demonstrating excellence in leading design process and execution (especially visually) in diverse organisations
* Experience managing complex projects and a team of designers while remaining actively involved in design work
* Advanced knowledge of visual design principles (typography, layout, colour, systems) demonstrating broad experience
* Strong processes understanding and ability to manage ambiguity, competing priorities, and limited resources with the ability to switch modes
* A clear point of view, balanced with openness to critique and feedback with deep care for usability and accessibility
* Commitment to skills development and mentorship
* A demonstrable passion for technology
* Thoughtful and self-motivated while being result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Exceptional educational achievement in design, or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Professional written and spoken English
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events up to two weeks long


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Marketing Technology Development Consultant
description:
**Engineer the journeys, integrations and automations that power modern customer experiences.**
 Accenture Song is where experiences are designed and delivered to help improve people’s lives—blending creativity, technology, and intelligence to create growth through relevance.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Marketing Technology Development Consultant who enjoys hands-on work in marketing platforms and technology, and who thrives in fast-paced, delivery-focused environments—especially within Adobe Experience Cloud and Salesforce Marketing Cloud ecosystems.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
- Build and enhance marketing technology solutions including automations, journeys/flows, segmentation logic, data extensions, and triggered communications.

- Implement and support integrations across the marketing technology landscape (CRM, web/app events, data platforms, SFTP, APIs).

- Develop, review, and support custom solutions and code (e.g., SSJS, AMPscript where relevant, API usage and validation).

- Troubleshoot platform, data, and integration issues; monitor automated jobs and improve reliability and performance.

- Collaborate closely with delivery teams, architects, marketers, DBAs, and cloud engineers to ensure smooth end-to-end solutions.

- Bridges the gap between marketing strategy and technology, managing the software, data, and automation tools that drive campaigns

- Contribute to delivery best practices including documentation, QA, release notes, and continuous optimization.

**What You Bring (must-have)**
- 3+ years of hands-on experience with Adobe or Salesforce platforms (or a comparable marketing automation platform).

- Solid technical problem-solving skills, particularly related to data flows, integrations, and automation reliability.

- Good working knowledge of SQL and comfort working with marketing and customer data.

- Ability to collaborate across disciplines and communicate technical topics clearly.

- Fluency in English (a Nordic language is a strong advantage and may be required for some client work).

**Nice-to-have**
- JavaScript (intermediate), HTML/CSS (basic), and responsive email fundamentals.

- Experience with customer experience optimization and identifying use cases

- Customer Data Platform (CDP) implementation & operations

**What We Offer**
- Hands-on work with modern marketing technology stacks and leading brands.

- Strong learning culture with access to certifications, communities, and mentoring.

- Competitive compensation and benefits aligned with the local market.

- A collaborative environment that values quality, ownership, and pragmatic delivery.

**Ready to join us?**
 We look forward to receiving your application. Please upload your CV, cover letter under
 *“Resume/CV”* 
 in the application portal.

title: Software Developer
description:
As a Entry-Level Software Developer reporting to Senior Director - Software Engineering, you’ll play a meaningful role in building the next-generation trading platform with the vision to become the most widely used in the world.
   

  

 You’ll thrive in this position if you’re exciting about designing, developing, and testing the deployment and operations of our innovative trading platform. Have a global attitude, and bring passion for innovation to a fast-paced, high-impact environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement IT solutions across applications, architecture, integration, and infrastructure.
* Analyze requirements and build, test, debug, and deploy software.
* Customize or create solutions based on client needs.
* Prepare detailed technical specifications to support infrastructure and architecture teams.
* Develop new technology concepts, define product specs, and collaborate across functions for successful delivery.


**Required Qualifications**
* A passion for programming, with proficiency in Python.
* A degree or equivalent experience in Computing Science, Engineering Physics, Interaction and Build, or a related field.
* An ability to engage and collaborate with your team and other stakeholders.
* A willingness to contribute to our Nasdaq culture and values.
* A curiosity and passion for cloud‑native technologies, modern deployment models, and scalable distributed systems


 This position will be located in Stockholm and offers the opportunity for a hybrid work environment at least 3 days a week in-office, subject to change, providing flexibility and accessibility for qualified candidates.
   

  

**Benefits & Rewards**
 We offer a competitive, well-rounded rewards package that supports you and your family - inside and outside work.
   

  

 Actual pay depends on your skills, experience, education, and location. In addition to base pay, we offer short-term incentives (bonus or commission) and long-term incentives (equity), where applicable, as well as the following benefits:
   

  

* Competitive base salary
* Annual bonus
* Annual equity grant
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan offering discounted company shares
* Pension plan
* 32 paid vacation days
* 6 additional days off per year
* Extra vacation time based on tenure
* Work from (almost) anywhere – up to 20 days/year
* Paid time off to volunteer
* Health insurance
* Sports club membership reimbursement
* 24/7 mental health support for you and your family
* Global mentoring program
* Unlimited access to e-learning platforms
* Hybrid work setup
* Modern and comfortable work environment with fresh fruit, snacks, and weekly Fika breaks


 For more information, visit Nasdaq Benefits & Rewards Career Page.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
 Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.
   

  

 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

title: Business Controller Sales
description:
*Trivs du i en affärsnära roll med många olika kontaktytor i en miljö där kvalitet, passion och innovation alltid står i centrum?* 




  





*Vill du ta nästa steg i karriären i en utvecklande roll hos ett av världens mest välkända premiumvarumärken?* 




  





*Välkommen till oss på Lindt & Sprüngli!* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Business Controller Sales får du en affärsnära roll i Lindt & Sprünglis nordiska verksamhet.
 



 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som vill arbeta i en dynamisk och internationell miljö.
 



 Du ansvarar för försäljnings- och marknadsanalyser, prissättning, budget och prognoser.
 



 Du får en viktig roll i att utmana och förbättra processer för ökad effektivitet och kvalitet.
 



 Placering på huvudkontoret i Solna, i en kultur präglad av kvalitet, passion och entreprenörsanda. Du ingår i ett team av tre Controllers och rapporterar till Head of Controlling.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden** 



* Marknadsansvar för Finland och Danmark. Tillsammans med Head of Controlling ge strategiskt stöd till sälj- och marknadsteamet med fokus på långsiktiga strategiska perspektiv.
* Vara affärspartner till sälj och marknad – ge insikter som stödjer strategiska beslut. Leverera djupgående analyser av produkt- och kundlönsamhet, marginaler samt förhandlingsstrategier.
* Säkerställa konkurrenskraftig och lönsam prissättning för Finland och Danmark.
* Ansvara för hela budgetprocessen för Finland och Danmark, samt säkerställa att den är i linje med organisationens mål och finansiella riktlinjer samt att koncernens tidsramar hålls.
* Leda prognosprocessen 2-3 gånger per år i nära samarbete med det nordiska teamet.
* Vara affärspartner till Business Unit Managers och stödja dem med finansiell rådgivning och analys i affärsrelaterade frågor.
* Säkerställa korrekta månadsbokslut med efterföljande rapportering.



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som har en ekonomiutbildning från Universitet/Högskola.
 



 Du har flerårig erfarenhet som Business Controller i en internationell koncern.
 



 Vi söker dig som arbetat inom FMCG med fokus på sälj och marknad.
 



 Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och trivs i föränderlig miljö.
 



 Du har ett driv, nyfikenhet och en vilja att göra skillnad – i ett bolag där passion och kvalitet alltid står högst på agendan.
 



 Du har mycket goda kunskaper i Excel och SAP och känner dig trygg i att driva system- och processutveckling.
 



 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska.
 



 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av systemen SAP SAC (Analytics Cloud) och Tagetik.
 



  





**Varför Lindt?** 




 Hos Lindt får du kombinera internationell miljö med starkt lokalt inflytande. Du blir en del av ett värderingsstyrt bolag som står för passion, kvalitet och hållbar tillväxt – och där du får både ansvar och frihet att påverka.
 



  





**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Lindt & Sprüngli Nordic med Mpya Finance. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen eller kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter David Andersson, david.andersson@mpya.se, eller Maria Brisheim, maria.brisheim@mpya.se.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**About Lindt & Sprüngli** 




 Lindt & Sprüngli is a renowned Swiss chocolatier and confectionery company known for producing premium chocolates since 1845. With a rich tradition of quality and innovation, Lindt has become synonymous with luxury chocolates worldwide. The company operates in over 120 countries and employs more than 14,000 people who are passionate about creating the finest chocolate products. Lindt’s commitment to excellence, sustainability, and customer satisfaction is reflected in every product that bears its name.

title: Department Manager for Distribution & Investments within WAM Tech
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you an experienced leader who is ready to take on a new challenge? This can be a great opportunity for you!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As the Department Manager for ITS Distribution & Investments within the WAM Tech area (Wealth & Asset Management) you will play a pivotal role in establishing and guiding a newly formed department. You will contribute to an upcoming large digital transformation and help build completely new capabilities to position SEB at the forefront of the industry. In this position you will drive innovation and develop an effective digital ecosystem that supports savers, traders and investors. You will work closely with business representatives from Investment & Trading Solutions (ITS) product area within Wealth & Asset Management.
   

  

 You will define the department’s vision, oversee solution development, and ensure our technology remains secure, efficient, stable and competitive. Leading a diverse, geographically distributed team, you will set strategy and actively manage software development to elevate SEB’s position in the savings area. This role reports to the Head of WAM Tech and is part of the WAM Tech management team. You will also be part of the ITS Distribution & Post Trade management team.
   

  

**As Department Manager You Will**
* Develop and implement the department’s strategy and transformation plans.
* Lead and set direction for both the department and your management team.
* Ensure cost efficiency and operational effectiveness.
* Build, develop, and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to drive effective cross-collaboration.
* Foster leadership within the department and drive change related to staffing, upskilling, work force planning and sourcing.
* Actively oversee a healthy application portfolio, focusing on risk, security, stability, and compliance.
* Communicate and collaborate closely with other tech managers and stakeholders from business, business services, and architecture.
* Champion modern, efficient ways of working, including software development principles, agile, DevSecOps, and lean methodologies.


**Who are you?**
* Action-oriented with proven track record of successfully leading international, tech-driven organizations and transformations.
* Skilled in long-term strategic planning and roadmap development and transforming them into well-anchored actionable plans.
* Deep expertise in software development, maintenance, agile methodologies, vendor management, and emerging technologies such as cloud, data and AI.
* Strong understanding of savings and investment services and client needs from a digitalization perspective; experience in Capital Markets and Wealth Management is especially valuable.
* Exceptional relationship-building and interpersonal skills, with the ability to foster trust among stakeholders and partners.
* Demonstrated ability to manage, lead, and inspire managers and teams within the technology sector.
* Hands-on, goal-oriented, and accountable for delivering high-value results.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Pragmatic, creative, and innovative in finding sustainable solutions to business challenges.
* Genuine passion for leadership and technology within the savings, trading, and investment sector.


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Hybrid work model
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology


**Ready to join?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We strive to ensure that every employee feels seen, heard and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 10-02-2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner at linn.larsson@seb.se

title: Full stack developer with strong mainframe competence | SEB, Stockholm.
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!*
**About The Role**
 We need to strengthen one of our accounting solution teams that is called Accounting EKOT with an additional enthusiastic Full stack Developer with strong mainframe competence coding and troubleshooting skills so that we can excel in our exciting journey to implement and modernize our accounting solution that fulfills SEB’s high demands on accuracy, security and quality. The Accounting EKOT team is an agile team located in Stockholm and is working on the accounting solution modernization roadmap and maintaining the bank’s daily accounting operations.
   

  

 Ensuring the smooth running of SEB´s financial systems is a very important responsibility performed by the team. Our system setup is mainly Mainframe applications where we are part of the consolidating and reporting flow to our end consumers in Finance. We develop and maintain both the back-end (mainframe online and batch) and front-end of the applications (.net and React).
   

  

 Now we are exploring new technologies and possibilities to implement a future solution. We work together with our Product Owner, Architects, and Stakeholders to define our next steps. As a team member, you will work with design, implementation, testing, deployment, troubleshooting, and maintaining smooth operations of our service including providing support to our users. Currently we are focusing on modernization of both the back-end mainframe applications and our front-end solution.
   

  

**Who are you?**
* You are a mainframe developer with several years of experience.
* You have preferrable been working with both back-end and front-end development.
* You have a genuine interest in technology and its ability to support our business.
* You share our interests in the areas of DevOps guidelines, and you have good communication skills in English.
* You can work together with others in the team or individually and you can communicate with stakeholders or vendors in a professional way.
* You are comfortable working in mainframe environment, and you are open to working with our front-end solution as well.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience of both back-end and front-end development
* Strong knowledge in mainframe development technologies and languages such as COBOL, JCL, IMS, OPC, Easytrieve, SQL, REXX
* Knowledge in programming languages such as Javascript, C#, Python or similar
* Preferable knowledge in front-end frameworks such as React or similar
* Databases such as DB2
* Experience in design, implementation, testing and deployment (CI/CD)
* Cloud technologies, GitHub and GitHub CoPilot for coding
* Basic knowledge in account management is a plus
* Troubleshooting and resolving issues in existing applications and maintaining smooth operations, including on-call duties
* Collaborate with team members to discuss ideas and to design and implement new features
* Investigate new tools and ways of working to become a better team and organization


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Hybrid Workplace
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Mobility within a large global company
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Empowering environment
* Deliver world-class service to customers


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than the 13th of March. If you have questions about the position, please contact Helena Åslundh Team Manager at helena.aslundh@seb.se. Note that we will not process any applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Partneransvarig, Stockholm
description:
Vi tar saker framåt, till dig och alla andra
   

  

 Från var som helst till vem som helst. Och tvärtom. PostNord är Sveriges och Nordens mest anlitade leverans- och logistikpartner för privatpersoner och företag. Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta i kommersiella positioner där både din strategiska och kommunikativa förmåga sätt på prov? Då kan detta vara ditt nästa steg!
   

  

 Nu söker vi en driven Partneransvarig till Stockholm med fokus på vår paket organisation.
   

  

**Du, vi och jobbet**
 Som Partneransvarig kommer du att tillhöra vårt affärsområde Paket och den del som ansvarar för våra ombud och paketboxar. Som Partneransvarig arbetar du med att bearbeta nya partners för att utveckla vår portfölj, tillika utveckla de befintliga partners för att säkra vår position på marknaden. Vårt uppdrag är att utveckla partnerskap i världsklass för att skapa den bästa kundupplevelsen och göra vardagen enklare för våra mottagare.
   

  

  

  

 Du arbetar i ett drivet team som finns utspritt över hela Sverige och det förekommer resor i tjänsten. Placeringsort är Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill vara del av att fortsätta bygga och utveckla vårt fantastiska nät av ombud och boxar, där du säkerställer att vi har rätt partners över hela landet.
   

  

  

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
* Säkra PostNords attraktivitet och erbjudande på marknaden genom relationsbyggande mot våra avtalspartners
* Strategiskt identifiera och bearbeta nya partners
* Hantera och teckna avtal med nya och befintliga samarbetsparters
* Självständigt planera, utveckla och följa upp vår portfölj av partners
* Koordinera aktiviteter ex. implementering av nya partners
* Ha tät kontakt med kollegor för att förstå behov och utveckla samarbetet kopplat till våra partners
* Ansvara för att utveckla och följa upp befintliga partners


 ,
   

  

**Vem du är**
* Mål och resultatinriktad: Du arbetar fokuserat och är alltid ansvarstagande
* Bygger förtroende: Tillit är grunden till bra relationer
* Affärsmässig: Du kommer till din rätt i kommersiella miljöer, där du alltid strävar efter att skapa en win-win-lösning för alla parter
* Kommunikativ: Du kan omvandla komplex information och på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt vis föra det vidare till dina samarbetspartners
* Initiativkraft: Framåtanda och vilja att lösa utmaningar, idag och imorgon
* Lösningsorienterad: Det är genom att lösa svåra knutar som arbetet tas framåt
* Du är unik: Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper


**Vad du tar med dig**
* Högskoleutbildning inom försäljning, ledarskap, ekonomi, management eller motsvarande är meriterande
* Minst tre års erfarenhet från en affärsinriktad och kundnära roll där du har byggt långsiktiga relationer gärna inom försäljning, projektledning eller e-handel
* Stor fördel om du har kunskap och erfarenhet kring e-handel och lösningar för ”last mile”
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i Office 365, särskilt Excel
* B-Körkort


**Välkommen med din ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan. För ytterligare information om rollen, kontakta Fredrik Linderoth på Fredrik.E.Linderoth@postnord.com. Urval sker löpande så ansök så snart som möjligt. I urvalet tillämpar vi testverktyg vid behov. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med start efter överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 För fackliga kontaktpersoner se Fackliga kontakter.

title: Tech Lead - Taktisk tillämpning
description:
Eccera söker nu en erfaren och engagerad systemutvecklare som vill ta ett övergripande tekniskt ansvar och axla rollen som Tech Lead inom utveckling av taktiska och säkerhetskritiska system. Vår kund är ett produktbolag med fokus på egenutvecklade lösningar för samhällsviktiga verksamheter, där tillgänglighet, säkerhet och kvalitet är avgörande genom hela produktlivscykeln.
 



  





 I rollen kombinerar du din breda tekniska kompetens med förmågan att leda, coacha och driva ett mindre utvecklingsteam framåt. Du arbetar nära produktledare och andra intressenter kring krav, tekniska lösningar och prioriteringar, med ett tydligt fokus på produktutveckling snarare än projektleveranser. Arbetet sker huvudsakligen på plats i norra Stockholm. Du och ditt team ansvarar för tekniska beslut, systemarkitektur, kodkvalitet och för att skapa ett hållbart, effektivt och långsiktigt utvecklingsarbete.
 



  





 Rollen innebär både strategiskt ansvar och operativt deltagande i utvecklingen.
 



  





 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket innebär att du blir anställd direkt hos vår kund.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling av säkerhetskritiska system där tillgänglighet, robusthet och informationssäkerhet är avgörande. Lösningarna används i samhällsviktiga miljöer och utgör en del av stödet till totalförsvaret, vilket innebär höga krav på kvalitet, säkerhet och långsiktighet. Här handlar det inte om generiska molntjänster eller teoretiska säkerhetsmodeller, utan om praktisk säkerhet i komplexa, ibland isolerade (air-gappade) miljöer, där systemens funktion i skarpa lägen är avgörande.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 



* Delta operativt i systemutvecklingen
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet, stabilitet och förvaltningsbarhet över tid
* Leda och stötta teamet i tekniska frågor
* Ta fram systemarkitektur och göra tekniska vägval
* Driva förbättringar av utvecklingsprocesser, verktyg och arbetssätt








**Krav** 




  





*Passande kandidater har:* 



* Bakgrund från produktbolag eller verksamhetsintern systemutveckling
* Helhetsförståelse för hur applikation, plattform, nätverk och drift samverkar (Server- och plattformslager, Nätverkslager och Applikationslager – runtime, integrationer och kommunikation)
* Erfarenhet som är bred, solid och senior – med helhetsperspektiv på system och produkt
* Tekniskt ledarskap med förmåga att se och ta ansvar för hela produktlivscykeln
* Trivs i mindre team (ca 3–6 personer) och värdesätter en nära, social och samarbetsinriktad arbetsmiljö
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift samt möjlighet att genomgå säkerhetsprövning



  





*Meriterande erfarenhet:* 



* HA-system och miljöer med geoseparation, redundans, lastbalansering och replikering
* Säkerhetssystem, certifikat, PKI samt autentisering- och auktoriseringslösningar
* Plattformar och infrastruktur för att ta system från utveckling och test till drift och förvaltning
* Air-gappade on-prem-lösningar och integration av tredjepartstjänster och egna delsystem i komplexa IT-miljöer



  





*Teknologier du kan komma i kontakt med:* 



* Docker, Kubernetes, Proxmox, OpenStack, ELK/Elastic stack
* VPN, brandväggar, proxy, nginx, apache, flask, CA, PKI
* IPv4/v6, IGMP, DHCP, DNS, routing och switching
* XMPP, WebRTC, Web API, REST API
* Python, Bash, Linux, Android, Git
* UEM, MDM, TAK, ICE, Mumble



  





 Du erbjuds en nyckelroll i ett växande produktområde där du får stort inflytande över både teknik och arbetssätt, och möjlighet att arbeta med lösningar som är samhällsviktiga på riktigt.
 



  





 Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass, vilket innebär att säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).

title: Lösningsarkitekt ERP & affärsplattform
description:
Brinner du för att skapa smarta digitala lösningar som förbättrar systemlandskap och säkerställer effektiva integrationer mellan olika applikationer och plattformar? Har du både teknisk kompetens, helikopterperspektiv samt ett affärsorienterat mindset?
 



  





 Norva24 erbjuder dig en spännande roll som Lösningsarkitekt för vår ERP & affärsplattform, där du får möjlighet att vara en nyckelperson i vår digitala transformation. Du kommer att arbeta med att implementera och vidareutveckla vår nya affärsplattform, där utrullning av vår nya ERP-lösning kommer ligga i fokus för hela koncernen. Du ges stort utrymme att påverka hur vi skapar effektiva och datadrivna processer.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




  





 Norva24 befinner sig i en spännande digital transformation där vi går från en decentraliserad IT-struktur till en modern, molnbaserad plattform. Vår vision är att skapa en enhetlig lösning som stärker datadrivet beslutsfattande och operativ excellens – en resa som kräver innovation, struktur och teknisk skärpa.
 



  





 Som
 **Lösningsarkitekt ERP & Affärsplattform** 
 får du en strategisk nyckelroll i att forma och implementera vår nya plattform för hela koncernen. Du blir en central drivkraft i att säkerställa effektiva och skalbara affärsprocesser som harmoniserar med vår digitala strategi i alla våra marknader – Norge, Sverige, Danmark och Tyskland.
 



  





 I rollen leder du utvecklingen och den kontinuerliga förbättringen av Norva24:s ERP- och affärsplattformslösning tillsammans med vårt operational development-team. Du ser till att våra system är integrerade, framtidssäkra och skapar en robust digital ryggrad som möjliggör datadrivna beslut och långsiktig tillväxt. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor får du vara med och bygga grunden för vår digitala framtid.
 



  





**Rollens främsta ansvarsområden:** 




  




* Implementera, utveckla och förvalta koncernens ERP- och affärsplattformsarkitektur.
* Fungera som lösningsarkitekt för ERP och relaterade affärsplattformar, med fokus på användarvänlighet, integration och samverkan mellan system.
* Leda integrationsprojekt (nya moduler, datakällor, processförbättringar).
* Stödja utvecklingen av en datadriven kultur och definiera KPI:er samt BI-verktyg.
* Överse den operativa förvaltningen av affärsplattformar (ERP, orderhantering, Payroll, TimeTracking).



  





 Rollen rapporterar till Head of IT och kommer vara placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm eller Oslo.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 




  




* Högskole/universitetsutbildning inom IT/teknik
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av ERP- och affärsapplikationslösningar.
* God förståelse för ett ERP:s olika lager (presentationslagret, applikationslagret och databaslagret).
* God förståelse för systemintegrationer och samarbetar väl med roller som ansvarar för BI-lösningar
* Engelska i tal och skrift, samt ett av de nordiska språken



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och söker dig som motiveras av att vara en del av en förändringsresa där allt inte är färdigstrukturerat. Du trivs med att ta egna initiativ och att hitta vägar framåt i en miljö där rutiner och processer fortfarande formas. Din kommunikativa förmåga är central för att skapa förståelse och samarbete mellan både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter. Du har en stark drivkraft att utveckla, skapa och lära nytt, samtidigt som du är skicklig på att bygga relationer och anpassa ditt sätt att kommunicera för att engagera och få med dig människor. Rollen innebär ett verksamhetsnära arbete med många kontaktytor, både internt och externt, och kräver en handlingskraftig ”get-things-done”-attityd som gör att du omsätter planer till resultat.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




  





 Hos Norva24 blir du en del av ett dynamiskt och växande internationellt företag där innovation och utveckling står i centrum. Du får en strategisk roll med stort ansvar och möjlighet att påverka vår digitala framtid. Vi erbjuder en kultur präglad av samarbete, engagemang och entreprenörsanda, samt kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.
 



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Norva24 med Level Recruitment. Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på ”ansök”-knappen här intill. Vid frågor vänligen kontakta rekryteringskonsult Jessica Bauer på 08-120 50 422. Urvalet av ansökningar sker löpande. Välkommen in med din ansökan!
 



  





**Nyckelord:** 
 ERP, lösningsarkitekt, datadriven, Odoo, affärsplattform, affärsapplikation.
 



  





**Om företaget** 




  





 Norva24 är Nordeuropas ledande aktör inom underhåll av underjordisk infrastruktur – en verksamhet som får samhället att fungera varje dag. På Group-nivå arbetar vi nära våra länder och lokala team för att stärka våra tekniska plattformar, processer och operativa arbetssätt. Här söker vi erfarna professionella som vill bidra med sin kompetens i en miljö där teknik och drift möter praktisk verklighet och höga krav på kvalitet och säkerhet.
 



  





 Sedan starten 2015, då flera lokala bolag gick samman och bildade Norva24, har vi fortsatt att växa och utvecklas. Idag finns vi i Norge, Sverige, Danmark och Tyskland, och vår ambition är tydlig: att vara Europas ledande aktör och en inspiration för hela UIM-industrin.
 



  





 Med kombinationen av lokala rötter, hög kompetens och toppmodern utrustning levererar vi trygga, effektiva och hållbara lösningar till både privat, offentlig och industriell sektor. Hos oss blir du en del av ett företag där vardagen är nära, beslutsvägarna korta – och där du får vara med och skapa den struktur och teknik som gör att hela organisationen fungerar.

title: Senior Utvecklare - Integration & Databaslösningar
description:
*Vill du arbeta med dataplattformar i en av de mest omfattande ERP- och cloud-transformationerna inom Ekonomi & Finans?* 




*Just nu genomför vi den största moderniseringen i enhetens historia, där Oracle Cloud ersätter ett komplext och affärskritiskt IT-landskap. Vi söker en senior Utvecklare som vill ta en nyckelroll i att designa, utveckla och framtidssäkra vår databas- och integrationsarkitektur. Det här är en roll för dig som vill kombinera djup teknisk expertis med arkitekturellt inflytande och som motiveras av komplexa utmaningar snarare än förvaltning av status quo.* 




  





**Om jobbet** 




 Som databasutvecklare hos oss blir du en central del av ett sammansvetsat integrations- och databasteam. Teamet ingår i ett agilt releasetåg och arbetar enligt ett lean-agilt ramverk baserat på SAFe. I rollen ansvarar du för datamodellering, SQL-utveckling, optimering och förvaltning av våra databaser kopplade till det nya ERP-landskapet i Oracle Cloud.
 



  





 Rollen kombinerar arbete med befintliga Oracle-lösningar och ett tydligt fokus på modernisering mot molnbaserade tjänster i OCI, inklusive ATP och moderna integrations- och DevOps-arbetssätt.
 



  





 Arbetsuppgifter i denna roll:
 


* Designa, utveckla och optimera datamodeller och databaser för Oracle Cloud-applikationer och relaterade system
* Utveckla avancerade SQL-lösningar (stored procedures, triggers och scripts; (PL/SQL-erfarenhet är meriterande)
* Arbeta med prestandaoptimering, felsökning och kvalitetssäkring i Oracle / SQL Server
* Bygga och förvalta datalager och databasintegrationer
* Stötta andra team med teknisk vägledning inom datamodellering, ERP-relaterade data och kubbyggande (EPM/EDM)
* Bidra till och vidareutveckla DevOps- och CI/CD-flöden för databasutveckling
* Delta i planering och leverans i teamets sprintar enligt LF:s lean-agila metodik
* Förvalta och utveckla OCI tillsammans med teamet



  





 För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du har:
 


* Flera års erfarenhet av databasutveckling, gärna i Oracle-miljö
* Mycket goda kunskaper i SQL och gärna PL/SQL
* Gedigen erfarenhet av datamodellering, prestandaoptimering, skapa och optimera stored procedures och triggers
* Erfarenhet av drift och förvaltning av databaslager, med fokus på att underhålla, övervaka och felsöka stored procedures och triggers
* God förståelse för databasarkitektur och integration mellan system
* Erfarenhet av DevOps och CI/CD-verktyg (t.ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI)
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



  





 Det är meriterande om du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av BI-lösningar (t.ex. Power BI)
* Erfarenhet av Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), ATP och/eller Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ERP-system, särskilt Oracle ERP/EPM/EDM
* Certifiering inom Oracle-databaser eller Oracle Cloud
* Tidigare arbetat inom bank- och finanssektorn
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och SAFe



  





 Du är analytisk, självgående och har ett starkt eget driv. Du har lätt för att samarbeta och trivs med att dela med dig av din kunskap till andra. Du är lösningsorienterad och har förmåga att se helheten i komplexa systemlandskap.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Ekonomi & Finans står inför en omfattande transformation där stora delar av IT-landskapet moderniseras och flyttas till molnbaserade lösningar. Vårt team spelar en central roll i denna förflyttning. Här får du vara med och påverka – både teamets form och vårt framtida arbetssätt. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk miljö med stora möjligheter till påverkan och utveckling.
 



  





 Enheten Ekonomi & Finans är Länsförsäkringar AB:s gemensamma ekonomifunktion med ansvar för koncernens verksamhetsstyrning, kapitalplanering och finansiella rapportering. Inom enheten finns grupperingen IT Utveckling och Förvaltning som har det övergripande ansvaret för utveckling och förvaltning av enhetens systemstöd.
 



  





**Mer information & kontaktpersoner** 




*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.* 




  





 Rekryterande chef: maria.gustafsson@lansforsakringar.se
 



 Facklig representant Forena: mirek.swartz@lansforsakringar.se
 



 Facklig representant Akademikerförbundet: anna.sandqvist@lansforsakringar.se
 



  





 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund. Genom självstyrande agila team och fokus på kundernas behov utvecklar vi innovativa tekniska lösningar och skapar framtidens kundupplevelse.
 



 Hos oss värdesätts samarbete, öppenhet och mångfald, och vi tror att olika perspektiv är nyckeln till lärande och innovation. Vi ger dig tryggheten att vara modig, bidra med nya idéer och påverka både din egen och företagets utveckling.

title: Service Engineer
description:
About Us
  
Cetasol is a fast-growing technology company at the forefront of energy optimization and digitalization in the maritime industry. Our mission is simple yet ambitious: to help vessel owners and operators become more efficient, sustainable, and future-ready through smart technology, real-time data, and AI-powered insights.
  
With installations running worldwide and partnerships with some of the biggest names in the industry, we are entering an exciting expansion phase. To support this growth, we are now looking for a skilled and motivated Service Engineer to join our team and help us deliver the next generation of maritime energy solutions.
  
  

The Role
  
As a Service Engineer at Cetasol, you will be on the frontline of our technology, ensuring smooth installations and top-class support for our customers. This is not just about fitting equipment onboard – it’s about being part of a team that transforms raw data into operational improvements and cost savings for shipping companies around the globe.
  
You will work closely with our project managers, developers, and customer success teams to bridge the gap between hardware, software, and real-world marine operations. The role is hands-on, varied, and highly collaborative – one day you might be configuring a new system for a pilot vessel, the next you could be supporting a customer halfway across the world.
  
  

Your Responsibilities
  
Provide technical support and troubleshooting, both remotely and onsite.
  
Collaborate with shipyards, customers, and installation partners to deliver seamless deployments.
  
Document and report all installations, configurations, and technical findings in a structured way.
  
Act as the voice of the field team, feeding back insights to help improve our product and processes.
  
Support training and knowledge sharing with customers and partners to strengthen adoption.
  
Able to install Cetasol hardware and software onboard vessels, ensuring robust and reliable setups.
  
  

You Are
  
A hands-on engineer with a background in service, maintenance, or installations.
  
Experienced with marine systems or industrial automation (advantageous, but not a strict requirement).
  
Familiar with communication protocols such as CANbus (J1939, NMEA2000), MQTT Modbus RTU or TCP/IP.
  
Knowledgeable in any programming language.
  
Confident in working independently and problem-solving under time pressure, while also thriving in a team environment.
  
Willing and able to travel to support customer projects, (drivers license is a plus).
  
Fluent in English (Swedish or additional languages are a plus).
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
At Cetasol, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, forward-thinking company that’s reshaping the future of maritime sustainability. We value initiative, creativity, and collaboration – and we make sure every team member has the space to grow.
  
Work with a product that makes a real difference for efficiency, regulations and climate impact.
  
Contribute to projects with global reach and relevance.
  
Be part of a supportive and passionate team where your input directly influences our success.
  
Grow your technical and professional skills in an environment that values learning and innovation.

title: Field Service Engineer Nordic & Baltic (m/f/d)
description:
We, EOS - world market leader for industrial 3D printing, are looking for you to support our customers in the Nordic & Baltic region in the area of Norrköping / Örebro / Linköping / Södertälje / Västerås.
At EOS, we're more than just a team; we're a community united by technology, where every action is a step towards meaningful change, and our independence is the cornerstone of our mission to make the world a better place for everyone.
Your Mission* Install, commission and calibrate our high‑tech EOS (Metal) systems directly at customer sites – from laser technology to optical sensors and imaging systems.
* Ensure reliable system performance through preventative maintenance, scheduled servicing and fast, effective troubleshooting (remote and on‑site).
* Manage your spare parts and tool inventory to ensure smooth and timely service delivery.
* Document all service activities in our service management system, including installation and repair reports as well as customer interactions.
* Support and train customers on system operation, maintenance and basic troubleshooting to empower them in their daily work.
* Carry out professional repair work, including part replacements and system adjustments, always meeting our high quality standards.

Your Talents* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related technical field.
* Proven experience in a field service role, preferably with complex optical, laser, or high-tech instrumentation.
* Strong understanding of optical principles, laser technology, and electronic circuits with proficiency in diagnosing and troubleshooting hardware and software issues
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with customers and colleagues.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken. Proficiency in one or more Nordic & Baltic languages is a significant advantage.
* Ability to work independently and manage time effectively, often under pressure.
* Valid driver's license and willingness to travel extensively within the Nordic region.
* Proficiency with standard office software (MS Office Suite) and experience with CRM or service management software.

Our Benefits* Flexible working time models, 30 days of vacation
* Company Car (also for private use)
* Attractive compensation package including a performance-based annual bonus at the end of the fiscal year.
* Health offerings
* Targeted further education opportunities within our LMS
  

Are you in?
We are looking forward to your application via our online system! If you have any questions, feel free to contact Meike Fleßner via recruiting@eos.info.
Please understand that we cannot accept applications by e-mail.
Our Vision:
Over 1000 sharp minds, about 60 nationalities, one goal: accelerating the world’s transition to Responsible Manufacturing.
Our proven technology, industrial 3D printing, has been extending the boundaries of manufacturing for over 30 years.
We work globally networked and prefer to think outside the box – and we’re looking for people who want to shape the future with us.
EOS welcomes individuals from all backgrounds, ensuring equal opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, expression, sexual orientation, age, or disability. At EOS, equity and inclusion are fundamental principles, and we believe in creating a work environment that is built on empathy, respect, and fairness. We are ALL IN.

title: Field Service Engineer Nordic & Baltic (m/f/d)
description:
We, EOS - world market leader for industrial 3D printing, are looking for you to support our customers in the Nordic & Baltic region in the area of Norrköping / Örebro / Linköping / Södertälje / Västerås.
At EOS, we're more than just a team; we're a community united by technology, where every action is a step towards meaningful change, and our independence is the cornerstone of our mission to make the world a better place for everyone.
Your Mission* Install, commission and calibrate our high‑tech EOS (Metal) systems directly at customer sites – from laser technology to optical sensors and imaging systems.
* Ensure reliable system performance through preventative maintenance, scheduled servicing and fast, effective troubleshooting (remote and on‑site).
* Manage your spare parts and tool inventory to ensure smooth and timely service delivery.
* Document all service activities in our service management system, including installation and repair reports as well as customer interactions.
* Support and train customers on system operation, maintenance and basic troubleshooting to empower them in their daily work.
* Carry out professional repair work, including part replacements and system adjustments, always meeting our high quality standards.

Your Talents* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related technical field.
* Proven experience in a field service role, preferably with complex optical, laser, or high-tech instrumentation.
* Strong understanding of optical principles, laser technology, and electronic circuits with proficiency in diagnosing and troubleshooting hardware and software issues
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with customers and colleagues.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken. Proficiency in one or more Nordic & Baltic languages is a significant advantage.
* Ability to work independently and manage time effectively, often under pressure.
* Valid driver's license and willingness to travel extensively within the Nordic region.
* Proficiency with standard office software (MS Office Suite) and experience with CRM or service management software.

Our Benefits* Flexible working time models, 30 days of vacation
* Company Car (also for private use)
* Attractive compensation package including a performance-based annual bonus at the end of the fiscal year.
* Health offerings
* Targeted further education opportunities within our LMS
  

Are you in?
We are looking forward to your application via our online system! If you have any questions, feel free to contact Meike Fleßner via recruiting@eos.info.
Please understand that we cannot accept applications by e-mail.
Our Vision:
Over 1000 sharp minds, about 60 nationalities, one goal: accelerating the world’s transition to Responsible Manufacturing.
Our proven technology, industrial 3D printing, has been extending the boundaries of manufacturing for over 30 years.
We work globally networked and prefer to think outside the box – and we’re looking for people who want to shape the future with us.
EOS welcomes individuals from all backgrounds, ensuring equal opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, expression, sexual orientation, age, or disability. At EOS, equity and inclusion are fundamental principles, and we believe in creating a work environment that is built on empathy, respect, and fairness. We are ALL IN.

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
Neko Health is a Swedish healthcare technology company co-founded in 2018 by Hjalmar Nilsonne and Daniel Ek. Neko's vision is to shift healthcare from reactive treatment toward preventative health and early detection. This requires completely reimagining the patient's experience and incorporating the latest advances in sensors and AI.


Neko Health has developed a new medical scanning technology concept to make it possible to do broad and non-invasive health data collection that is convenient and affordable for the public. The company is based in Stockholm, offering the Neko Body Scan experience at locations in Stockholm, London and Manchester, with over 500 employees.


We’re building medical devices that enable large-scale, preventative healthcare. That means designing our own hardware, firmware, and software end-to-end — and running it in production, every day, in our clinics.


We’re now looking for an experienced **Firmware Engineer** to join our Hardware & Firmware team in Stockholm.


This is a hands-on role for someone who enjoys working close to the metal, solving hard systems problems, and taking responsibility from early bring-up all the way to a deployed medical product.




**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Develop embedded Linux firmware: bring-up, device drivers, platform features, and diagnostics
* Work close to hardware with sensors such as cameras and radar units
* Write efficient low-level code in C and C++
* Debug and root-cause complex hardware and software issues
* Optimize systems for performance, reliability, and resource efficiency
* Collaborate with electronics, systems, and software teams from concept to production
* Prototype, experiment, and tinker — we expect engineers to build and test, not just design




**Who you are**
---------------

* You have 5+ years of relevant experience working with embedded systems
* You have a Master’s degree (or equivalent practical experience)
* You have extensive experience with embedded Linux development
* You’re highly proficient in C and/or C++
* You have deep knowledge of Linux internals (scheduler, memory management, concurrency, filesystems)
* You care deeply about performance, stability, and correctness
* You’re comfortable debugging in kernel context
* You’re hands-on by default — you like building things and making them work




**Nice to have**
----------------

* Experience with RTOS-based firmware development
* Familiarity with electronics and hardware debugging tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, etc.)
* Understanding of low-level communication protocols (UART, SPI, I²C, TCP/IP)
* Experience with the CUDA toolkit
* Background in medical devices or other regulated industries

title: Senior System Verification Engineer (Medical Device)
description:
Neko Health is a Swedish healthcare technology company co-founded in 2018 by Hjalmar Nilsonne and Daniel Ek. Neko's vision is to shift healthcare from reactive treatment toward preventative health and early detection. This requires completely reimagining the patient's experience and incorporating the latest advances in sensors and AI.


Neko Health has developed a new medical scanning technology concept to make it possible to do broad and non-invasive health data collection that is convenient and affordable for the public. The company is based in Stockholm, offering the Neko Body Scan experience at locations in Stockholm, London and Manchester, with over 500 employees.


We are currently seeking a **Senior System Verification Engineer** to join our multidisciplinary engineering team. In this role, you will take ownership of system-level verification activities across the product lifecycle, from early concept through industrialization and market release. You will work closely with hardware, firmware, and software teams to ensure our medical device systems meet applicable standards and regulatory requirements, translating compliance needs into practical, testable requirements and robust verification strategies that ensure safety, performance, and regulatory compliance.

**Responsibilities**

* **Partner with design engineers** throughout the product development lifecycle to ensure medical device systems are compliant with applicable standards (e.g., IEC 60601 series) and regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, MDR) from concept through industrialization.
* **Translate regulatory requirements and standards** into actionable, practical guidance for design decisions, serving as a bridge between regulatory/compliance and engineering teams.
* **Influence product requirements early** by working with cross-functional teams to ensure requirements are testable, traceable, and specify compliance needs effectively.
* **Develop efficient verification methodologies, tools, and workflows**, for end-to-end, integration, and regression testing, implementing automation where it optimizes work and increases reliability.
* **Coordinate with external test houses** for specialized testing (e.g., EMC, electrical safety, environmental.) and manage the interface between internal requirements and external verification activities.
* **Ensure continuity of test requirements through design transfer**, maintaining product quality, safety, and compliance as products move from development to manufacturing and industrialization.
* Create comprehensive test reports documenting results, defects, and compliance status, and communicate findings to stakeholders
* Contribute to the creation and maintenance of traceability matrices, ensuring all system requirements are covered by verification activities
* Provide technical feedback and drive continuous improvement of verification processes and practices.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related technical field.
* 5+ years of experience in system verification and validation within a regulated industry, ideally medical devices
* Experience working with complex embedded systems (hardware, firmware, software) and performing system-level testing, such as EMC, electrical safety, environmental tests
* Strong familiarity with IEC 60601 series standards (IEC 60601-1, IEC 60601-1-2, etc.) is highly preferred, with proven ability to translate standard requirements into verification strategies
* Familiarity with regulatory frameworks such as FDA, MDR, and ISO 14971.
* Hands-on experience developing and executing both manual and automated test methods.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across hardware, firmware, software, quality, regulatory, and external partner teams.
* Good documentation skills and proficiency in English.

title: Electronics Design Engineer
description:
Neko Health is a Swedish healthcare technology company co-founded in 2018 by Hjalmar Nilsonne and Daniel Ek. Neko's vision is to shift healthcare from reactive treatment toward preventative health and early detection. This requires completely reimagining the patient's experience and incorporating the latest advances in sensors and AI.


Neko Health has developed a new medical scanning technology concept to make it possible to do broad and non-invasive health data collection that is convenient and affordable for the public. The company is based in Stockholm, offering the Neko Body Scan experience at locations in Stockholm, London and Manchester, with over 500 employees.

**About the role**


We are looking for a **hands-on Electronics Design Engineer** to join our Hardware & Firmware organization. In this role, you will design and own electronics for sensor-dense medical systems, working closely with Mechanical, Firmware, Software, Verification & Validation, Manufacturing, and Production teams.You will take responsibility across the full product lifecycle — from early requirements and concept development to verification, validation, and production support — with a strong focus on robustness, data quality, and real-world reliability.This is a practical, lab-facing role for engineers who want to see their designs deployed in real clinical environments.

**What you'll do**

* Own **electronics design end-to-end**, from requirements and concept through schematic, layout, verification, and production support
* Design **robust mixed-signal PCBs** for sensor-dense medical systems, balancing signal integrity, power, thermal, and EMC constraints
* Select and integrate **MCUs / DSPs and key components**, working closely with firmware and software teams
* Lead **board bring-up, debugging, and root-cause analysis** of prototypes and production hardware
* Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure designs are **manufacturable, testable, compliant, and scalable**

**What you bring**

* Degree in Electrical Engineering (or equivalent practical experience)
* Minimum **4 years of hands-on electronics product development** experience
* Strong experience with **mixed-signal PCB design**, including schematic, layout, and simulation
* Solid understanding of **power design, signal integrity, and EMC/EMI** in real products
* **Hands-on experience with board bring-up, debugging, and lab instrumentation** in embedded systems

**Bonus points**

* Experience working in the **medical or other regulated industries**
* Experience with **RF design or RF-sensitive systems**
* Experience developing **test interfaces or test systems** (e.g. Python, LabVIEW, MATLAB)

title: Hardware Designer
description:
Job summary
  
As an R&D Engineer in our Electronics team, you will help design and shape the electronic heart of the next generation controllers.
  
  

**You will:**  

* Develop electronics and firmware for advanced robotic control systems.
* Work on power electronics, digital and analog circuit design, SoC based solutions, and embedded architectures.
* Review and refine PCB layouts, ensuring robust, high quality designs for real world industrial environments.
* Collaborate with global R&D sites to exchange expertise and drive innovation across teams and technologies.
* Support software, test, and mechanical teams in cross functional development of complete robotic systems.
* Expand your experience in embedded systems development, gaining deep insight into how electronics integrate into full robot controllers.
* Perform thorough electronics and system level testing to ensure performance, reliability, and long-term stability.
* Utilize knowledge of Linux, VHDL, or Xilinx where applicable—useful but not required.

title: Senior Online Engineer
description:
**About the Role & Team**


Disney Digital Entertainment, a division of Disney Experiences, is redefining how audiences interact with The Walt Disney Company—creating the ‘digital front door’ that unites all of Disney’s magic into a cohesive, interactive universe.


Disney Digital Entertainment is seeking talented individuals passionate about pushing the boundaries of scalable systems that power unforgettable experiences. You’ll design and optimize high-performance platforms.


As a Senior Online Engineer, you will play a key role in developing and maintaining high-performance, scalable software platforms. You will design and implement robust infrastructure solutions and create APIs to meet the organization’s data needs. With your in-depth expertise, you will work on high-volume, transactional systems, ensuring they are reliable, efficient, and capable of handling high load. You will contribute to the development of design specifications, collaborate with internal and external teams, and mentor less experienced engineers. Your problem-solving skills will be vital in addressing complex challenges and improving technical tools and processes. While working with defined methods, you will often make independent decisions and help shape approaches to meet team and project objectives.


You’ll join a team grounded in our Disney values — acting with Integrity, welcoming everyone through Inclusion, embracing boundless Creativity, working together through Collaboration and caring deeply for our Community. These values shape how we work and how we support one another every day.


This role can be based remotely in Sweden, Denmark, Finland or Norway.


**What You Will Do**

* **Build Scalable Online Systems:** Design and maintain robust APIs and backend services that handle high-volume, real-time interactions. Keeping Disney’s digital experiences fast, reliable, and magical.
* **Performance:** Ensure systems run smoothly under heavy load low latency, high availability, and seamless scalability.
* **Collaborator:** Work closely with engineers, designers, and external partners. Share knowledge, mentor junior team members, and help shape best practices.
* **Strategic Problem-Solver:** You think ahead, identify potential issues early, and develop practical solutions that make a real impact.

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

* **Proven Expertise:** You have a strong track record of building and maintaining complex online systems at scale.
* **Technical Leadership:** Skilled in high-performance server development and API design, with the ability to guide architectural decisions.
* **Languages:** Adaptable to any programming language required for the task, experience in Go is a plus, which is currently the most widely used language in the team.
* **Collaborative Mindset:** You thrive in cross-functional teams, communicate clearly, and mentor others.

title: Software Test Engineer Access Control QA – Embedded Firmware, Lund
description:
Job Title
Software Test Engineer Access Control QA – Embedded Firmware, Lund
Job Description*Are you passionate about the point where software meets hardware?*  

*Do you want to ensure the quality of products you can physically hold in your hand?**At Axis, we are "Innovating for a smarter, safer world." In our Access Control product area, we build the core technology that secures buildings, assets, and people globally. We are looking for a skilled Software Test Engineer to join one of our most critical firmware development teams, right here at our global HQ in Lund.* *This isn't just another software testing role. You will be the quality champion for the embedded firmware that powers our door controllers and card readers—the very heart of our physical security ecosystem.*
Your future team
We are the Access Control QA team dedicated to ensuring the Access Control product area delivers Axis products and solutions that earn customer trust, ensuring reliability and satisfaction.  

  

Our team consists of 20 software test engineers with mixed experience, both seniors, specialists and junior engineers, and a widespread background. We value teamwork and each other and care deeply about the quality culture! Together we innovate, secure and improve the world - through collaborative solutions that combine expertise, trust and a relentless pursuit of excellence.  

  

Get to know our QA organization:  

Axis Communications • Meet Quality Assurance! - Jobcast | Podcast on Spotify
What you’ll do here as a Test Engineer  

You will be embedded within a highly experienced agile scrum team. This team is the crucial bridge between pure software and electronic engineering; they write the first line of code that runs on new hardware.
Your mission will be to ensure our firmware is robust, reliable, and secure from the earliest development stages.
Your key responsibilities will include:* Leading firmware quality in hardware projects: Take the firmware QA lead role in our new hardware projects. You will plan, coordinate, and execute the complete test plans/strategy, from the first prototype to the final product.
* Deep, hands-on testing: Go beyond the surface. Perform detailed manual and automated testing of firmware features, focusing on stability, performance, security, and hardware interaction.
* Driving "Shift-Left" further: Collaborate directly with developers in your scrum team to integrate testing early and often, catching issues "close to the metal" before they escalate.
* Building a sustainable future: Actively contribute to our long-term quality strategy by improving test methods, expanding our automation frameworks (we love Python!), and identifying new tools and techniques.
* Ensuring reliability and usability: from a customer perspective.


Who are we looking for?  

We're looking for someone with strong technical curiosity and a collaborative spirit. You are pragmatic, take initiative, and enjoy the challenge of working in a senior, fast-paced team. You will be a perfect fit if you have:* Proven experience: 3-5 years in software testing within a scrum team, with a strong preference for experience in embedded systems, firmware, or IoT products.
* A leader's mindset: You are comfortable planning and leading test activities for a project, coordinating with other testers and developers, and reporting on quality status.
* Technical skills: You have experience with both manual and automated software testing. You aren't afraid to read a datasheet, connect a logic analyzer, or write a script to solve a problem.
* Collaborative skills: You possess excellent communication skills and can articulate technical issues and quality insights to developers, product managers, and other stakeholders.
* A customer-centric view: You naturally think about how the end-user will experience the product's reliability and usability.


It would be fantastic if you also have experience with:* Scripting/programming for test automation (e.g., Python, C).
* Performance, stress, and long-term stability testing.
* Basic hardware debugging tools (multimeters, oscilloscopes).
* Leveraging AI-assisted tools (e.g. GitHub Copilot) for tasks such as generating test ideas, coding test scripts, or analyzing results.
* CI/CD tools and environments (e.g., Jenkins, Git).


What Axis has to offer  

We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Henrik Åkesson.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-03-05*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
